title: Wildlands Field Studies in Chile
text:
I participated in a 6 week field study course in Northern Patagonia in winter 2024. I not only received academic course credit towards my major, but also gained invaluable hands on experience, friendships, personal growth, and field skills.
Some of the skills I am most proud of include:

observations and field notes (when I started paying attention, I started asking questions too!)
planning ahead and problem solving on the spot







scientific process and data collection
backpacking, camping, and wilderness safety skills







engaging with Patagonian culture
learning about broad environmental concepts like succession, volcanoes, glaciers, and climate, and applying them locally to the Los Lagos region of Chile







introspection and self-reflection

title: Rachel Brody
text:
I created this website to share my interests, skills, and experiences, academic, professional, and otherwise.


I was born and raised in Half Moon Bay, CA. My love of the outdoors is what lead me to pursue a degree in environmental studies. I have many interests within the field of environmental studies, including wildlife conservation, glaciers, and climate change. In my free time, you can find me outside, hiking, running, playing frisbe with my dog, surfing, or backpacking. Or passionatley wacthign basketball! Go Warrior



BS in Environmental Studies (2024) | University of California, Santa Barbara Minor in Latin American and Iberian Studies (2024) | University of California, Santa Barbara
